definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
motion of no confidence (against the government, in parliamentary debates)

sentences.english: Space project motion is right now apropos 20 hours.
sentences.chinese: 此時距離項目動議恰好20個小時。

sentences.english: Once they move in, they take good care of the tree and make it grow.
sentences.chinese: 一旦他們在動議，他們照顧好樹，使它成長。

sentences.english: All those oppose please raise your placards.
sentences.chinese: 反對此動議的代表請舉牌。
這項動議已經被擱置起來。

sentences.english: The motion was advanced in order to embarrass  the progress of the bill.
sentences.chinese: 爲了阻礙提案的通過，動議被提出了。

sentences.english: This initiative is an important step toward reversing the resource curse.
sentences.chinese: 這個動議是朝着扭轉資源詛咒邁出的重要一步。

sentences.english: He seconded the motion to increase membership fees.
sentences.chinese: 他附議增加會員費的動議。

sentences.english: They railroaded the motion through the committee.
sentences.chinese: 他們使那項動議在委員會中草草通過。

sentences.english: Learn the baby freeze move for breakdancing in this free video hip hop dance lesson.
sentences.chinese: 在這個學習免費視頻街舞課霹靂寶貝凍結動議。

sentences.english: The motion stuck as soon as it was put forth.
sentences.chinese: 該項動議一經提出就遭到擱置。

sentences.english: New proposals would begin to erode the last bastion of press freedom in the country.
sentences.chinese: 而新的動議將開始侵蝕這片俄國新聞自由的最後據點。

sentences.english: Learn the import of Cuban motions in ballroom dance in this free dancing video lesson.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解了古巴進口動議交誼舞在這個自由跳舞的視頻課。

sentences.english: We've defeated moves to build another office block.
sentences.chinese: 我們已否決另建一座辦公樓的動議。

sentences.english: The original motion has to be seconded before it can be amended in discussion.
sentences.chinese: 原來的動議必須有人附議後，纔可以再被修改。
該動議獲得了迅速通過。

sentences.english: The motion was steamrollered through in the lower chamber.
sentences.chinese: 該項動議在下院被強行通過了。

definition: lower house of bicameral assembly/House of Representatives (USA)/Chamber of Deputies
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to make a formal request/formal request/to make a claim (law)
member of the US House of Representatives
to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
